# Notes of EEE

## 	Lecture-1 ---------

### Common Things you need to know for this Field

| ![Image result for register electronic component](data:image/jpeg;base64,) Resistor:star: | Cell    |
| :----------------------------------------------------------- | ------- |
| Capacitor:star:                                              | Battery |
| Inductor:star:                                               | Source  |

### Equation for Resistance:

-  Series : $ R_s = R_1 + R_2 + R_3 +{}{}{}...$
-  Parallel: $ R_p = \cfrac{1}{R_1} + \cfrac{1}{R_2} + \cfrac{1}{R_3} + {}{}....$ 

	### A noticeable behavior in parallel and series:slightly_smiling_face:

 - Series:
   
     - Same current flows
 - Parallel:
   
     - Same voltage in every register

### Concept of Node:new_moon_with_face:

- Node: it is a point, where many elements meets :love_letter: 

- ![image-20200202224951635](C:\Users\User\AppData\Roaming\Typora\typora-user-images\image-20200202224951635.png)   

    <big>It will  take a different name when voltage gets changed otherwise keeps same</big>



### Calculating equivalent resistance :star2:

â€‹		While calculating equivalent resistance you must follow two rules:

- **Node**:
    - if only one node is same between two circuits then they are series
    - if two node is common then they are parallel
- **Direction**(where you start to calculate):
    - Start calculate from the left side
        ![Image result for nodes naming in circuit](data:image/png;base64,)
        :arrow_backward:--------------$\longleftarrow$-------------------

# Lecture - 2 ------------------

## Ohm's Law

Ohmâ€™s law states that the voltage v across a resistor is directly proportional to the current $i$ flowing through the resistor

â€‹                                                         $v \propto i$

## Case of Circuit

- ### Open

- ### Short
